* The Knight Riders Group, owned by Shah Rukh Khan, Juhi Chawla, and Jay Mehta, is investing in a 10,000-capacity cricket stadium near Los Angeles as part of the Major League Cricket (MLC) plan.
* The stadium will be located in Great Park, Irvine, Southern California, and will be home to MLC's Southern California-based franchise.
* The investment in the stadium is expected to be around $30 million.
* The stadium will have state-of-the-art facilities, including training facilities, locker rooms, luxury suites, and an international-grade pitch, making it suitable to host major international cricket events.
* The stadium could potentially host the ICC Men's T20 World Cup in 2024 and the 2028 Olympic Games cricket event, if cricket is included in the Olympics.
* The MLC co-founders, Sameer Mehta and Vijay Srinivasan, believe that the stadium will have a transformational impact on cricket in the Greater Los Angeles region.
* The stadium's location in Great Park, Irvine, is ideal due to its existing sports facilities and its ability to serve the local cricket-loving community and host major international cricket events.
